trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: はじめに

trans-unit.source: In computer programming, iteration is the repetition of a sequence of code. A loop is a form of iteration. A loop repeats code until a certain condition is met.
trans-unit.target: コンピューター プログラミングにおけるイテレーションとは、あるコードのシーケンスの繰り返しのことです。そしてループとはイテレーションのひとつ形態です。ループは、特定の条件が満たされるまでコードを繰り返します。

trans-unit.source: Questions for the students:
trans-unit.target: 生徒への質問:

trans-unit.source: Do you use shampoo to wash your hair? Most will say ‘Yes’.
trans-unit.target: みなさんは髪を洗う時にシャンプーを使いますか。ほとんど全員 「はい」と答えるでしょう。

trans-unit.source: Have you ever read the instructions on a bottle of shampoo? Most will say ‘No’.
trans-unit.target: シャンプーのボトルに書いてある使い方の説明を読んだことがありますか。ほとんどみんな「いいえ」と答えるでしょう。

trans-unit.source: Most of us have never read the instructions on a bottle of shampoo, because we already know how to use shampoo.
trans-unit.target: 私たちのほとんどはシャンプーの使い方をすでに知っているので、シャンプーの容器に書いてある使用方法を読むことはありません。

trans-unit.source: What algorithm could you write for shampooing your hair? Example:
trans-unit.target: 髪をシャンプーする手順を表すアルゴリズムを書くとしたらどのように書きますか？ 例:

trans-unit.source: Wet hair.
trans-unit.target: 髪を濡らす

trans-unit.source: Apply shampoo to wet hair
trans-unit.target: 濡れた髪にシャンプーを適用する。

trans-unit.source: Scrub shampoo into hair
trans-unit.target: シャンプーで髪をゴシゴシとこする。

trans-unit.source: Rinse shampoo out of hair
trans-unit.target: 水でシャンプーを洗い落す。

trans-unit.source: If you did read the instructions on a bottle of shampoo, you may read similar instructions as the ones you just wrote with one added step at the end.
trans-unit.target: シャンプーのボトルの使い方を読むと、きっとあなたが今書いたアルゴリズムとほとんど同じ、ただし最後に 1 つだけステップが追加された、使い方が書いてあるでしょう。

trans-unit.source: That step is ‘Repeat.’ How does this one extra step affect the algorithm?
trans-unit.target: そのステップは「繰り返す」というものです。 この 1 つの余分なステップがアルゴリズムにどんな影響を与えるでしょうか？

trans-unit.source: In computer programming, this is known as the ‘shampoo algorithm’ and is an example of a loop.
trans-unit.target: コンピューター プログラミングでは、これは 「シャンプー アルゴリズム」として知られていて、ループの一例でもあります。

trans-unit.source: It is also an example of an ‘infinite’ or ‘endless’ loop as the algorithm keeps repeating with no condition that ends the looping.
trans-unit.target: これはまた、ループを終了させる条件がない、「無限」または「終わることのない」ループのアルゴリズムの例です。

trans-unit.source: Share with your students the history of ‘Lather, Rinse, Repeat.’
trans-unit.target: Share with your students the history of ‘Lather, Rinse, Repeat.’

trans-unit.source: Lather, Rinse, Repeat: Hygiene Tip or Marketing Ploy By Lauren Goldstein October 11, 1999 http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1999/10/11/267035/index.htm (FORTUNE Magazine) – In Benjamin Cheever's novel The Plagiarist, a marketing executive becomes an industry legend by adding one word to shampoo bottles: REPEAT.
trans-unit.target: Lather, Rinse, Repeat: Hygiene Tip or Marketing Ploy By Lauren Goldstein October 11, 1999 http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1999/10/11/267035/index.htm (FORTUNE Magazine) – In Benjamin Cheever's novel The Plagiarist, a marketing executive becomes an industry legend by adding one word to shampoo bottles: REPEAT.

trans-unit.source: He doubles shampoo sales overnight.
trans-unit.target: He doubles shampoo sales overnight.

trans-unit.source: This bit of fiction reflects a small yet significant eddy of U.S. consumer angst: If we REPEAT, are we or are we not playing into the hands of some marketing scheme?
trans-unit.target: This bit of fiction reflects a small yet significant eddy of U.S. consumer angst: If we REPEAT, are we or are we not playing into the hands of some marketing scheme?

trans-unit.source: It turns out that in real life there's a reason you should repeat, or at least there used to be.
trans-unit.target: It turns out that in real life there's a reason you should repeat, or at least there used to be.

trans-unit.source: In the 1950s, when shampoos began to be mass-marketed, we didn't wash our hair all that often--once or twice a week, as opposed to five times a week as most of us do now.
trans-unit.target: In the 1950s, when shampoos began to be mass-marketed, we didn't wash our hair all that often--once or twice a week, as opposed to five times a week as most of us do now.

trans-unit.source: Also, we used a lot more goop in our hair.
trans-unit.target: Also, we used a lot more goop in our hair.

trans-unit.source: It was the age of Brylcream and antimacassars, remember.
trans-unit.target: It was the age of Brylcream and antimacassars, remember.

trans-unit.source: Paul Wallace, the director of hair-care research and development for Clairol, says that when cleaning agents in shampoo came up against that amount of oil and goop, "it depressed the lather." A second application was needed to get the suds that consumers expected.
trans-unit.target: Paul Wallace, the director of hair-care research and development for Clairol, says that when cleaning agents in shampoo came up against that amount of oil and goop, "it depressed the lather." A second application was needed to get the suds that consumers expected.

trans-unit.source: Lots of suds mean that hair is already clean.
trans-unit.target: Lots of suds mean that hair is already clean.

trans-unit.source: Maybe too clean (there's no oil to break through), but consumers like it.
trans-unit.target: Maybe too clean (there's no oil to break through), but consumers like it.

trans-unit.source: FORTUNE asked Frederic Fekkai, the noted and notably expensive New York City hairdresser, what he thought about the double lather.
trans-unit.target: FORTUNE asked Frederic Fekkai, the noted and notably expensive New York City hairdresser, what he thought about the double lather.

trans-unit.source: He says, "Yesterday I put oil on my hair for a different look and went to a restaurant where the smoke was horrible.
trans-unit.target: He says, "Yesterday I put oil on my hair for a different look and went to a restaurant where the smoke was horrible.

trans-unit.source: This morning I realized I had to do two shampoos."
trans-unit.target: This morning I realized I had to do two shampoos."

trans-unit.source: At any rate, Wallace says advances in shampoo technology mean that only one application of, for instance, Clairol's Herbal Essences is sufficient to break through the oiliest hair.
trans-unit.target: At any rate, Wallace says advances in shampoo technology mean that only one application of, for instance, Clairol's Herbal Essences is sufficient to break through the oiliest hair.

trans-unit.source: The company has stricken the use of both REPEAT and REPEAT IF DESIRED from all Clairol products.
trans-unit.target: The company has stricken the use of both REPEAT and REPEAT IF DESIRED from all Clairol products.

trans-unit.source: Yet a lot of brands, like Suave by Unilever and L'Oreal, still say REPEAT.
trans-unit.target: Yet a lot of brands, like Suave by Unilever and L'Oreal, still say REPEAT.

trans-unit.source: Others, like Unilever's Finesse and Revlon's Flex, opt for the less imperative REPEAT IF DESIRED.
trans-unit.target: Others, like Unilever's Finesse and Revlon's Flex, opt for the less imperative REPEAT IF DESIRED.

trans-unit.source: Procter & Gamble uses REPEAT IF NECESSARY on Pantene.
trans-unit.target: Procter & Gamble uses REPEAT IF NECESSARY on Pantene.

trans-unit.source: Getting consumers to wash twice can, of course, increase sales--in ways one might not imagine.
trans-unit.target: Getting consumers to wash twice can, of course, increase sales--in ways one might not imagine.

trans-unit.source: Double sudsing leads to dry hair, Fekkai points out, and that means more beauty products!
trans-unit.target: Double sudsing leads to dry hair, Fekkai points out, and that means more beauty products!

trans-unit.source: "When you do two shampoos, even if you don't usually use a conditioner, you have to use a little," he says.
trans-unit.target: "When you do two shampoos, even if you don't usually use a conditioner, you have to use a little," he says.

trans-unit.source: "The conditioner becomes very important." REPEAT.
trans-unit.target: "The conditioner becomes very important." REPEAT.

trans-unit.source: FOLLOW WITH CONDITIONER.
trans-unit.target: FOLLOW WITH CONDITIONER.

trans-unit.source: Words Cheever's marketer could have retired on.
trans-unit.target: Words Cheever's marketer could have retired on.

trans-unit.source: --Lauren Goldstein
trans-unit.target: --Lauren Goldstein

trans-unit.source: From Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lather,_rinse,_repeat): Lather, rinse, repeat (sometimes wash, rinse, repeat) is an idiom roughly quoting the instructions found on many brands of shampoo.
trans-unit.target: From Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lather,_rinse,_repeat): Lather, rinse, repeat (sometimes wash, rinse, repeat) is an idiom roughly quoting the instructions found on many brands of shampoo.

trans-unit.source: It is also used as a humorous way of pointing out that such instructions if taken literally would result in an endless loop of repeating the same steps, at least until one runs out of shampoo.
trans-unit.target: It is also used as a humorous way of pointing out that such instructions if taken literally would result in an endless loop of repeating the same steps, at least until one runs out of shampoo.

trans-unit.source: It is also a sarcastic metaphor for following instructions or procedures slavishly without critical thought.
trans-unit.target: It is also a sarcastic metaphor for following instructions or procedures slavishly without critical thought.
